page.title: 08IRISH PLACE NAMES
page.content:
Most places in our area have {GAELIC} names e.g.
{ALTNAGELVIN...}ALT NA nGEALBHAN{means HEIGHT OF THE SPARROWS. {LISNAGELVIN...}LIOS NA nGEALBHAN{means FORT OF THE SPARROWS. {ARDLOUGH...}ARD LOCH{means}HIGH LAKE. {TULLYALLY...}TULACH ALAIDH{means SMALL HILL{or}BEAUTIFUL HILL {DRUMAHOE...}DRUIM NA HABHA{means THE BACK OF THE RIVER {GOBNASCALE...}GOB NA SCEAL({SCAIL) {means,}BEAK OF THE SHADOWS,BEAK OF THE BIRDS,BEAK OF THE STORIES There is a {GAELIC }school in an area of {DERRY}which is called {STEELSTOWN. It was opened in {1983},it caters for{ {FORTY}children,{TWO}of which are from the{WATERSIDE}area.The rest of the children are from the{DERRYSIDE}of our town.It is called{GAELSCOIL CHOLMCILLE
